title: Thunderbird for Mobile
creator: egtaylor1
content:
Hello guys,

I've been a passionate user of (and advocate for) Thunderbird for more than 20 years now and was quite delighted when Thunderbird for Mobile was launched. At last I could use Thunderbird on my phone and tablet as well as my desktop! I've used Bluemail (the best of the rest in my view) on my mobile for some time and am currently comparing its performance side by side with Thunderbird for Mobile, having just installed the latter. In terms of fetching message I'm actually finding Bluemail much speedier at the moment and don't know why this is so. For example, I can often read incoming emails on Bluemail five minutes or more before they arrive via Thunderbird. So far as I know, I think I've tweaked all the necessary settings on Thunderbird but may be overlooking something. Can anybody suggest a way to speed up Thunderbird? I'm more than keen to keep on using it.

Cheers,

Grant

title: Account, Reading mail, Always show images: Add option to show previously accepted
creator: crusoe2
content:
Account, Reading mail, Always show images: Yes/No:- Add option to show previously accepted "show images" that have already been accepted.

By default I don't show images on my email accounts (NO setting), however, I subscribe to various news letters etc. that contain the same header images. Can an additional option be added to the "Show images" setting to allow images that have been manually accepted/shown previously to be displayed in newly arrived emails without further prompting?

If this already exists in Android TB then I cannot find the setting for it! Regards Crusoe
